description: A modification of dissimule after resemble and semblance.

verbs.description: dissemble (third-person singular simple present dissembles, present participle dissembling, simple past and past participle dissembled)

examples: Perhaps it was right to dissemble your love.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To deliberately ignore something; to pretend not to notice.
examples: Synonyms: disregard, take no notice of; see also Thesaurus:ignore

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To falsely hide one's opinions or feelings.
